metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22752 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Christian Holler and Jason Kratzer reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 95. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 96.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
